Grooming your long haired rabbit once a week is not recommended. Long haired rabbits require regular grooming, at least every other day, to avoid matting and tangles in their fur. If you skip grooming for a week, it can become very difficult to untangle these mats and can be uncomfortable for your rabbit. 

Regular grooming also helps to prevent hairballs, which can be dangerous for your rabbit. Hairballs can cause intestinal blockages, which can be life-threatening. 

Grooming your rabbit is very important for their overall health and well-being, and it's essential to establish a regular grooming routine. You can make grooming sessions more manageable by breaking them down into shorter, more frequent sessions, using proper grooming tools, and providing treats to reward your rabbit for cooperating. If you're finding it challenging to groom your rabbit, consider consulting with a professional pet groomer or a veterinarian for guidance.
